title: Arugula With Hearts Of Palm, Grapefruit, And Oil-cured Olives
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Arugula With Hearts Of Palm, Grapefruit, And Oil-cured Olives a try. This recipe makes 4 servings with 217 calories, 3g of protein, and 15g of fat each. For $1.4 per serving, this recipe covers 14% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and fodmap friendly diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. A mixture of arugula, pepper flakes, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is solid. Try Arugula With Hearts Of Palm, Grapefruit And Oil-cured Olives, Grapefruit and Hearts of Palm Salad, and Grapefruit, Hearts of Palm & Shrimp Salad for similar recipes.
instructions: Finely grate1/2 tsp. zest from the grapefruit; set aside. Slice just enough off the top and bottom of the grapefruit to expose the fruit. Stand the grapefruit on one cut end and slice away all of the peel and white pith. Working over a bowl, cut the segments away from the membranes, letting them fall into the bowl. Then, over another bowl, squeeze the membranes to get any remaining juice. Cut each segment into thirds.    In a small bowl, whisk 2 Tbs. of the reserved grapefruit juice and the zest with the oil, vinegar, rosemary, red pepper flakes,1/4 tsp. salt, and a pinch of pepper.    In a small bowl, mix the grapefruit segments, hearts of palm, and olives with 2 Tbs. of the dressing.    Toss the arugula and parsley in a large bowl with a generous pinch of salt and 3 Tbs. of the dressing. Divide the arugula among 4 plates, top with the hearts of palm mixture, and drizzle with the remaining dressing, if desired.                  nutrition information (per serving):        Calories                        (kcal):                      200, Fat                        (kcal):                      17, Fat Calories                        (g):                      150, Saturated Fat                        (g):                      2.5, Protein                        (g):                      3, Monounsaturated Fat                        (g):                      12, Carbohydrates                        (mg):                      13, Polyunsaturated Fat                        (mg):                      2, Sodium                        (g):                      490, Cholesterol                        (g):                      0, Fiber                        (g):                      3,                     Photo: Scott Phillips          Rate this Recipe and View Reviews

steps.step: Finely grate1/2 tsp. zest from the grapefruit; set aside. Slice just enough off the top and bottom of the grapefruit to expose the fruit. Stand the grapefruit on one cut end and slice away all of the peel and white pith. Working over a bowl, cut the segments away from the membranes, letting them fall into the bowl. Then, over another bowl, squeeze the membranes to get any remaining juice.

Cut each segment into thirds.    In a small bowl, whisk 2 Tbs. of the reserved grapefruit juice and the zest with the oil, vinegar, rosemary, red pepper flakes,1/4 tsp. salt, and a pinch of pepper.    In a small bowl, mix the grapefruit segments, hearts of palm, and olives with 2 Tbs. of the dressing.    Toss the arugula and parsley in a large bowl with a generous pinch of salt and 3 Tbs. of the dressing. Divide the arugula among 4 plates, top with the hearts of palm mixture, and drizzle with the remaining dressing, if desired.
